Should the US policy of interventionism be in place?
 Why or why not?
 
 Interventionism:
 The policy or practice of intervening, especially:
 The policy of intervening in the affairs of another sovereign state. 
 The use of government power to control or influence domestic economic activity
 
 Examples: Bush's roadmap for peace
 Bush sending money to help people in Africa fight aids
 
 Con - It creates enemies
 
 Pro - It creates allies
 
 It reality it creates both. Some con's will say that we need neither.
 Consider the following
 
 If an epedimic broke out in the US, and the entire nation was in shambles with hundreds dieing by the day... Wouldn't we want our allies to help us out?
 Maybe they would just let us die out...
 Hopefully it will never come to that, and it probably won't. But I think my point is understood. 
 
 Consider the following:
 
 A major reason why 9/11 occured is because of interventionist policy in the middle east (our support for Israel)......
 
 - Attempts to give both sides of the argument -

They should intervene when it is totally necessary, but should not go out looking for trouble.
